newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat shares continue recovery, with IFI, IFIL.
newsitem.headline: Fiat shares continue recovery, with IFI, IFIL.

text.p: Shares in Italian industrial group Fiat continued to rise on Tuesday with the Agnelli family holding groups IFI and IFIL also registering strong advances on the Milan bourse.

Dealers said that Fiat was continuing to recover after hitting a new low for the year some days ago at 3,920 lire, while IFI and IFIL have recently underperformed the market after the two shares were replaced in the Mib30 index of top Italian stocks in late September.
The Agnelli family holds its stake in Fiat through the holding groups IFI and IFIL.

At 0930 GMT, Fiat shares were up 1.15 percent at 4,220 lire while IFIL rose 3.29 percent to 4,150 lire and IFI was up 3.84 percent at 11,870 lire. All three shares showed rises of over two percent yesterday.
